suncertify.ui

Interface ConfigDialog

  • All Known Subinterfaces:
    ClientConfigDialog, ServerConfigDialog, StandaloneConfigDialog
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    ClientConfigDialogGUI, ServerConfigDialogGUI, StandaloneConfigDialogGUI

    public interface ConfigDialog
    ConfigDialog is the root interface of all the configuration dialog interfaces i.e. (client, standalone, server) Each configuration dialog requires different configuration properties from the user, those of which are clearly defined in each individual interface.
    Author:
    Kieran O'Brien

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void addActionListeners()
      Adds the relevant action listeners to this configuration dialog
      void addUIComponents()
      Sets the container pane of the dialog JFrame to use a specific layout manager and adds the appropriate layout constraints to each UI component
      void closeWindow()
      Closes the configuration dialog that is being displayed
      void disableErrorLabels()
      Disables relevant error labels from being visible in the dialog
      void loadExistingConfigurationProperties()
      Populate the configuration dialog text fields with the existing values from the relevant properties file if present Design Note: This satisfies the project requirement "configuration must be persistent between runs of the program"
      void saveConfigurationProperties()
      Saves the configuration properties that were entered by the user to the relevant properties file
      boolean validateConfigurationProperties()
      Validates the specific properties for this configuration dialog

      • validateConfigurationProperties

        boolean validateConfigurationProperties()
        Validates the specific properties for this configuration dialog
        Returns:
        True if properties are valid

                                 throws java.io.IOException
        Saves the configuration properties that were entered by the user to the relevant properties file
